fields.description:
h3. Summary
Manage Gadgets page doesn't show Gadget URL properly 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Manage Gadgets* page: <JIRA_URL>/plugins/servlet/gadgets/admin
# Add a gadget URL
# Check Gadget URL

h3. Expected Results
You see added _Gadget URL_, eg: https://extranet.atlassian.com/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.confluence:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/conf-activitystream-gadget.xml

h3. Actual Results
You see JSON representation of _Gadget URL_ object:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
{absolute: true, authority: extranet.atlassian.com, fragment: null, host: extranet.atlassian.com, opaque: false, path: /rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.confluence:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/conf-activitystream-gadget.xml, port: -1, query: null, rawAuthority: extranet.atlassian.com, rawFragment: null, rawPath: /rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.confluence:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/conf-activitystream-gadget.xml, rawQuery: null, rawSchemeSpecificPart: //extranet.atlassian.com/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.confluence:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/conf-activitystream-gadget.xml, rawUserInfo: null, scheme: https, schemeSpecificPart: //extranet.atlassian.com/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.confluence:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/conf-activitystream-gadget.xml, userInfo: null}
{code}

Page view:
 !JRA_62259_gadget.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
JIRA 6.4.13 doesn't have this problem
This is a rendering issue, Gadget functionality shouldn't be affected. 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Manage Gadgets page doesn't show Gadget URL properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62258].
  {panel}

While on a JIRA board, its possible to create an issue that won't show up on the board, and you are presented with the message:

"Your issue [issue id here] has been created but is not currently visible."

This message doesn't tell me what to do to fix the issue, or where I can fix it at all.

Consider suggesting how the problem can be fixed,:

 

"Your issue [issue id here] has been created but is not currently visible. Try deselecting board filters to see your issue on this board."
fields.summary: Your issue has been created but is not currently visible: Improved feedback

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62256].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA, for the create issue notification, would send an email with only certain system fields. It would not include any custom fields that have been specified during issue creation. 

h3. Suggested Solution

The JIRA email notification for Issue Creation should include all fields and values specified during issue creation, including custom fields.
fields.summary: As a user, I want JIRA notifications to include the custom fields and their values on the Create Issue notification email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62254].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When importing issues through a CSV file, if there are semicolons (;) on the attachment name, the import will fail with the following error: *Cannot parse FILEINFO as attachment info: too many tokens*. This fails even if you quote the file name as in "file;name.jpg", it will still fail.
h3. Expected Results

The import concludes normally.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
 \{noformat}
 Cannot parse 'ATTACHMENT INFO' as attachment info: too many tokens
 \{noformat}
  
h3. Workaround

Remove the semicolon from the attachment name.
fields.summary: Cannot import with semicolon on attachment name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62251].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Epic Link is not correctly set on issues imported through CSV.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic {code}Epic name: Epic1{code}
# Import issues through CSV {code}Summary,Epic Link
Test issue, Epic1{code}

h3. Expected Results
Issue imported should have an Epic linked

h3. Actual Results
The import is done without errors but Epic link field is blank
 
h3. Notes


h3. Partial Workaround

If you don't have many epics, you can bulk edit the issue, one search per epic. For example, if you have these epics with these stories:
* Epic: ABC-1: Epic Name: My Epic 1
** Story in Epic ABC-1: ABC-2, Epic Link: My Epic 1
** Story in Epic ABC-1: ABC-3, Epic Link: My Epic 1
* Epic ABC-4: Epic Name: My Epic 2
** Story in Epic ABC-4: ABC-5, Epic Link: My Epic 2

It's possible to:
# Import the 'Epic Name' to 'Epic Name', as expected
# Create a new text field (My Epic Link)
# Import 'Epic Link' to this text field (My Epic Link)
# For each Epic, search for stories with the Epic Link, for example
{code}
'My Epic Link' = 'My Epic 1'
{code}
# Bulk edit it to change the 'Epic Link' to 'My Epic 1'
fields.summary: Import epic link through CSV is no longer working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62250].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Issue collector not loading/appear when user has no access to JIRA but has Confluence (as example) Access.
h3. Environment

Instance must have JIRA and CONFLUENCE installed and an issue collector being used. (Tests were made in cloud environment)
Also, this HTML embedded code bed can be used for testing [http://www.csgnetwork.com/htmlcodetest.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue collector
 # Assign a proper default reporter
 # Create a user limited to access confluence only (must not be allowed to access JIRA and)
 # Log in to JIRA as that user (either logging out and entering that user credentials or using the log "in as user" feature)
 # Paste the Issue Collector html code in the test site i.e: [http://www.csgnetwork.com/htmlcodetest.html] and test it.
h3. Expected Results


Should be able to open an issue normally using the collector.
h3. Actual Results

When using the "log in as user" feature, it shows the issue collector tab, but won't load (stuck on loading wheel). When entering user credentials in confluence, then trying to test the issue collector, the collector tab won't show.

\{noformat}
...
\{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

Took a deep check and couldn't find any related bug.
h3. Workaround

Log out from Atlassian applications before using it, or use access with incognito mode.
fields.summary: Issue collector not loading/appear when user has no access to JIRA but has Confluence Access
Allow to set a default custom field configuration (and permission scheme) to be used for all new projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62247].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When users tick the check box to collect browser info in Issue Collector's configuration page, it now has a below message (check box) in the feedback page. 
- !image-2016-08-16-22-11-22-264.png|thumbnail! 

This would give customers an option whether to include the browser info or not.
- {noformat}Include data about your current environment, like the browser and page URL. This helps us understand your feedback better.{noformat}

As a user who is collecting this information, we'd like to hide the check box field so that customers don't have an option to not provide the environment data.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to remove "collect browser info" check box in Issue Collector.
-  !image-2016-08-16-22-11-41-628.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide an option to remove "collect browser info" check box in Issue Collector

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62245].

h3. Problem Definition
There is no documentation on how to execute REST API using [PL SQL|https://oracle-base.com/articles/misc/oracle-rest-data-services-ords-create-basic-rest-web-services-using-plsql]

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.summary: REST API for PL SQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62244].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, users can login into JIRA using the same username concurrently from different browser/machine. For some organization, this could be flagged as a security breach since we are allowing _could_ be 2 different users at the same time. One of the examples is a JIRA user might have an idea that he is hacked if when he logs in and there is a warning message saying that he is already logged into JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a feature where JIRA Administrator can choose to allow/block concurrent user sessions.
fields.summary: Block multiple logins from same username
Updating of Field Layouts is an expensive process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62239].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It would be helpful if a user with the iOS app could view a different set of users from the main dashboard. Currently, it appears to only be recently viewed issues, but if you could select a specific project, or do custom advanced searches, create your own filter, etc. that would be very useful.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a way to view open issues in a specific project
* Custom Searches / Advanced searches
fields.summary: Ability to view more issues on app dashboard than simply recently viewed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62238].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It would be useful for iOS app users to receive an in-app notification, especially when they are outside of business hours.

_e.g. a critical issue is created in the queue_

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide some notifications that are iOS app specific, and not only within JIRA and email
fields.summary: Ability to receive notifications for issues via the app

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62237].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, any JIRA Administrative user has permissions to delete a project. Projects are not recoverable especially in JIRA Cloud, so this can cause a lot of issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a *Delete Project* permission separate from administrators so that only specific trusted users will have the ability to delete an entire project.
fields.summary: Provide ability to restrict Delete Project permissions
Option to more information of linked issues in the issue navigator.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the logs, the error are still thrown regarding the mixed case group names on LDAP side ([JRA-36424|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36424]), however, no impact on functionality wise


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a new user from Active Directory.
# Synchronise that user.
# Change one of the groups the user belongs to to uppercase, e.g.: change Ninja-Superstar to ninja-superstar.
# Attempt to login.

h3. Expected Results
The user logs in without any worries. No logs/warning are thrown

h3. Actual Results
User functionality not impacted.
However, in logs, following are thrown and groups are not updated with name changes. 

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2016-07-28 09:33:52,402 Caesium-1-4 WARN ServiceRunner [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] remote group name [ JR_test ] casing differs from local group name [ JR_TEST ]. Group details will be kept updated, but the group name cannot be updated
{noformat}
fields.summary: Mixed case group names on LDAP for User Management still throws error in Log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62233].
  {panel}

h3. *Symptoms*

When customer attach a JPEG image via shortcut key "Ctrl + V" to a JIRA issue in IE 11, JIRA will auto convert the image type to PNG and the image is unable to load in Internet Explore 11 browser. This issue only happen in IE browser and is not happen for chrome browser.

If attach a JPEG image via shortcut key "Ctrl + V" to a JIRA issue in Chrome browser, the image is able to preview in IE11.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Login JIRA with IE 11 browser.
 # Open a JIRA issue
 # Google a JPEG image
 # Right click > Copy Image
 # locate back to JIRA issue
 # Enter "Ctrl + V" to attach image
 # Click the image to preview in JIRA issue.
h3. *Expected behavior*


Image is previewed without any error.
 !error.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Actual behavior*

JIRA fail to load the image
 !error 2.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Workaround 1*
h3. Upload image from *More* >> *Attach files* or click the *browse* from Attachments section.

 
h3. *Workaround 2*

Use other browser.
fields.summary: Image unable to load when attaching JPEG image with Ctrl + V in IE11

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

When a JIRA user performs a search in JIRA that uses the IN condition (e.g. Key in (.....)) if the options is very large (200+), JIRA would do one of the following depending on the browser and JIRA Version when they attempt to perform an Export:

*+Update+*

This behavior is not limited to the *IN* operator. Performing any search in JIRA with about 3k characters in the JQL, we were able to reproduce the issue of the export failing with slightly different observations
 
{panel:title=Excel Exports}
*JIRA 6.3.11*
 # Do nothing: Firefox
 # Result in White page: IE, Chrome

(i) Looking at the console while performing this, you would see the 400 bad page exception.

*JIRA 7.2*
* All threw the 400 bad page exception for searches with the *IN* operator was used.
* Chrome would throw a white page(blank page) if the in operator is not used and the data exceeds 3000 from our count.
* Firefox does nothing, however when we looked at the browser console, we noticed that the 400 page error was also thrown in it.

{panel}
This doesn't seem to work irrespective of the export choice.

*Steps to Reproduct*
 # Go to the search issue page in JIRA.

*Expected Behavior*

JIRA would export the issue correctly with no problem what so ever.

 

*Actual Result*

JIRA would throw one of the errors I mentioned above or throw the 400 bad page exception.


*Further Test & Workaround*

If you reduce the options in the in condition(refine the search) or the amount of characters in the JQL (2595 has been confirmed to work by our customer)JIRA would be able to export the result correctly.

(i) The issue does not occur in JIRA 6.2 hence this seems like a regression.
fields.summary: JQL search with large number of characters cannot be exported

# Create a new project with any project type

# Put a project key contains invalid characters. ie.  "1SD"
# Click Submit

*Expect*
Validation error telling project key is invalid

*Actual*
Validation error shows up but quickly disappears(within 1 sec), project lead field value got clear, if I try to type something in the project key field, it's behaves weird as show in the attached video.
fields.summary: Project key fields is funky on create new project screen after submit project creation with a invalid project key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62230].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
We have Statuses mapped in these 3 categories: *to do*, *in progress*, *done*. Nowadays if you create a status, i.e: "Test Phase", let's say this status is present in multiple projects, you'll have to set a status category, it is restricted that the same status be as "in progress"  in all projects. There might be teams where the status "test phase" should be "done" for them and for other teams it should be "in progress", due to process needs.

h3. Suggested Solution
Set the same status to have different categories on a project basis.


h3. Workaround 
Found no workaround.
fields.summary: Map statuses by project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62229].
  {panel}

*Business Case:* We support 65+ small web applications, and in order to know which issue is for what application, we are using components.  The thought of creating 65+ JIRA projects (and growing) didn't work, and labels did not work either so we decided to use components. This has proven to be very effective. However, now we would like to know more information about the component, but we are limited to the out-of-the-box fields.

*Ask:* We would like to have the ability to add custom fields to the component. Examples would be URL links, General Text fields, Dates, Email, just to name a few.  When looking at the schema, there is no relationship between the Component Table and the Custom Field Table. Could that be added? OR could you add more fields, such as what was state earlier directly to the table.

Thank you very much,

Karen (GRAINGER)
fields.summary: Abiltiy to add custom fields to Component - directly to table or via relationship to custom field table)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62226].
  {panel}

There is a new permission scheme in JIRA 7.2 
v7.2.0-RC-20160801091245#72002-sha1:b623912

Best practice is that schemes are named with their type of scheme, e.g. "XYZ Permission Scheme" not "XYZ Scheme". This is because there are many places in JIRA admin pages where having the scheme type is a useful context.

Suggestion: at secure/admin/ViewPermissionSchemes.jspa replace

Default software scheme
Default scheme for Software projects.

with the text:

Default Software Permission Scheme
This is the default scheme for Software projects.
fields.summary: Name of Permission scheme is confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62225].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When running a JIRA instance on a Google Container Engine behind the google http load balancer, if users try to remove a permission from a permission scheme, the http balacer will reject it as "malformed". 

According to the [RFC 2616|https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt]

"A server SHOULD read and forward a message-body on any request; if the request method does not include defined semantics for an entity-body, then the message-body SHOULD be ignored when handling the request"
fields.summary: Malformed request error when editing permission schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62221].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a filter is shared with disabled groups, if someone tries to change the ownership from that filter, it fails without throwing errors on the UI and no logs about it can be seen on {{catalina.out}} either

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to {{Administration > System > Shared Filters}}
# Search for a filter shared with disabled groups
# Click on {{Cog Icon > Change Owner}} and try changing the ownership on the UI

h3. Expected Results

The ownership from the filter is successfully changed.

h3. Actual Results

The filter ownership stays the same and no errors are thrown.

h3.Workaround

The following can be done to correct this:

# Backup JIRA using the [XML Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/backing-up-data-185729581.html#BackingUpData-UsingJIRA%27sXMLbackuputility] utility or your native database tools.
# Stop JIRA
# Run the following command to delete associations to inactive groups: {code:sql}delete from sharepermissions
where sharetype = 'group'
and param1 not in (select group_name from cwd_group G join cwd_directory D on D.id = G.directory_id where D.active = 1){code}

After that, start JIRA again and change the filter ownership.
fields.summary: Change filter owner fails silently for disabled groups

{panel:title=Summary|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}

h3. Summary

In the exported Excel sheet of a search filter, Issue Link Fields with multiple links shows in multiple column with the heading Outward issue link (Blocks), Outward issue link (Cloners), Outward issue link (Duplicate) and Outward issue link (Relates)

h3. How to Replicate

# Go to Search Filter
# Filter Projects which contains multiple Link Issues
# Export (CSV, All Fields) or (Export (CSV, Current Fields)
# Link Issue Column shows multiple 

h3. Expected Result:
Value on the heading for Link shows the name same as UI in a single column

eg. Link issues with single column

h3. Actual Result:
Value on the heading for Link Issues fields shows in multiple columns:

Eg. Outward issue link (Blocks) | Outward issue link (Cloners) | Outward issue link (Duplicate) | Outward issue link (Relates)

And repeated Columns if there are multiple value in the same column:
Eg.  Outward issue link (Blocks) | Outward issue link (Cloners) | Outward issue link (Duplicate) | *Outward issue link (Relates) | Outward issue link (Relates) | Outward issue link (Relates)*

{panel}
fields.summary: Export (CSV, All Fields) and Export (CSV, Current Fields) Issue link value shows in multiple column

  {panel}

{panel:title=Summary|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}

h3. Summary

In the exported Excel sheet of a search filter, the custom fields in heading shows 'Custom field (<field name>)'

h3. How to Replicate

# Go to Search Filter
# Filter Projects which contains Custom Fields
# Export (CSV, All Fields) or (Export (CSV, Current Fields)
# 'Custom field (<field name>)' will show on the Custom Field Header

h3. Expected Result:
Value on the heading for Custom Fields in the shows the name same as UI  

h3. Actual Result:
Value on the heading for Custom Fields in the shows the 'Custom field (<field name>)'

Eg. Custom Field is "Reference"
In the UI shows "Reference"
In the Excel shows 'Custom field (Reference)'

h3. Workaround

* As a workaroud you can use the Export HTML Report (current field/all fields). You can then edit the name of the file from <filename>.html to <filename>.xls and it should open up in your spreadsheet program. You may run into this bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61891

{panel}
fields.summary: Export (CSV, All Fields) and Export (CSV, Current Fields) shows the heading as 'Custom field (<field name>)'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62215].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
For a logged in user, the /myself API should return the user's email address. At the moment, it may return an obfuscated email address (if that setting has been enabled).

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable obfuscated email address setting
# Request /rest/api/2/myself

h3. Expected Results
The email address should be returned (e.g. adrizen@atlassian.com)

h3. Actual Results
"adrizen at atlassian dot com" is returned
 
h3. Notes
The profile page UI corrects for this problem

h3.Workaround
Remove the obfuscation on the UI layer.
fields.summary: Myself API returns an obfuscated email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62214].
  {panel}

h3. Problem: 
Trailing whitespace can cause a lot of confusion in both the email address (mail handlers will not be able to find users/reporters) and usernames (people struggle to log in).

h3. Suggestion:
Trailing whitespace should be considered a mistake and be trimmed, or at least validated.
fields.summary: Strip trailing whitespace from email address (and username)
Map statuses by project
Please provide a way to stop receiving notification email messages for specific field changes

In the customers' view for the "Getting started with JIRA Core" clicking on the "let's get started" buttons in below pages open the button image instead of sending you to the linked pages:

This works fine if you open the same pages in the Confluence view (but customers do not have access to that).

 

Steps to reproduce:
# Navigate to one of the urls above

# See that instead of going to the next page the button image icon is displayed
 !02-result.png|thumbnail!

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62204].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The unattended upgrade will allow for the installer responses to be automated, however once the instance is setup there's no automated configuration after this.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a method to use a pre-existing database configuration and install certain plugins after install.
 
h3. Workaround 

One sample workaround would be to script this, for example:

# Create another database and copy the data from the existing one.
# Download the standalone installer.
# Install it with the pre-answered responses.
# Stop the instance.
# Edit the {{server.xml}} as appropriate.
# Update {{dbconfig.xml}} with the new database.
# Populate {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} with the required plugins.
# Start up the instance, which will then upgrade the data (or simply start with it), and enable the plugins.
fields.summary: Expand the unattended upgrade install process to allow for installation of plugins and additional configuration

h3. Summary
The _Secure SSL_ flag under the Advanced Settings section in the LDAP settings does not work when using Delegated LDAP/Internal with LDAP Authentication in JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Delegated LDAP (AD) in JIRA
# Checking the *Secure SSL* checkbox and hit the _Save and Test_ button
# if we edit the LDAP directory again and verify that option, it will no longer be checked

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62199].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When using their own domain to send notification to JIRA Users, Atlassian Cloud customers need to add an SPF record, with the Cloud ip ranges, to make sure the notifications are not bounced by other email providers.
Having to adjust SPF record every time the ip range is changed is not ideal. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an SPF DNS entry for the Cloud ip range, for example _cloudrange.atlassian.com. (like _spf.google.com)

This would enable customers to refer to the SPF DNS and avoid the need to adjust their DNS record, when the Cloud ip range is changed.
 
h3. Workaround

Add the ip range, mentioned in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Database+and+IP+information, to the SPF record 
Adjust the record every time the ip range is adjusted.
fields.summary: SPF DNS for Cloud ip range

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
If a search result provides more than 1000 issues, when you try to click on the page with issues beyond 1000 results, the screen fades to opaque white and doesn't error at all.

This is likely due to the search limit, but there's no error to say why it might be doing this.

There's a feature request at JRA-45639 to display more than 1000 results, but it claims there is an error seen. On my particular instance, there is no error.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.217.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search JIRA results on an instance with more than 1000 issues. A good option would be to show all issues.
# Navigate through pagination until you reach the results with more than 1000 issues (usually about page 21)
#* Or, go to this link and click No.21 https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=&startIndex=950
# The screen will fade to white and freeze.

h3. Expected Results
Some kind of error message saying a limit has reached.

h3. Actual Results
* No error on screen
* No error in logs
* No error in Dev Tools.

h3.Workaround
Increase *jira.search.stable.max.results* from JIRA's advanced configuration as described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-increase-the-jira-search-results-limit-on-the-issue-navigator-357696242.html.
* Note that there are potential performance impact on the JIRA server from loading excessively large searches frequently, we don't recommend increasing this search results limit without considering the performance impact from it's usage.
fields.summary: When max search results limit is reached, there is no error.

h3. Summary
Getting the following error in the activity stream if all streams are chosen.
_"An error occurred while trying to retrieve recent activity"_
All streams work if any 1 stream is unchecked.

JIRA DVCS Connector Plugin (jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin) throws NullPointerException when getting activity stream on dashboard. Plugin is not visible in available streams, so there is no way to disable it explicitly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Some actions in JIRA (not able to reproduce problem locally). 
# Open dashboard with Activity stream

h3. Expected Results
Activity stream is loaded. 

h3. Actual Results
Getting the following error in the activity stream: _"An error occurred while trying to retrieve recent activity"_
{noformat}
2016-08-09 06:44:27,048 ajp-bio-127.0.0.1-8009-exec-3449 ERROR admin 404 12 10.33.220.7 /plugins/servlet/streams [streams.internal.servlet.StreamsActivityServlet] Error getting activity
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.util.SystemUtils.getAllProjectKeys(SystemUtils.java:137)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.webwork.IssueAndProjectKeyManagerImpl.getAllProjectKeys(IssueAndProjectKeyManagerImpl.java:91)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.streams.DvcsStreamsActivityProvider.includeHistoricalProjectKeys(DvcsStreamsActivityProvider.java:317)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.streams.DvcsStreamsActivityProvider.getActivityFeed(DvcsStreamsActivityProvider.java:272)
        at com.atlassian.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider.getActivityFeed(LocalActivityProvider.java:115)
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Plugin full path:  com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin
Problem fixed in later version *3.3.20*+ 
JIRA 6.4.12: has  version *3.2.4*
JIRA 7.1.8: has *3.3.30*

h3.Workaround
* If you don't have any DVCS Accounts configured (integration with Bitbucket or GitHub) then disable JIRA DVCS Connector Plugin.
* Some users reported that problem fixed after JIRA restart.

h3. Problem Definition

As a System Admin user, I have been given a license key which I want to apply. I know how to find features of JIRA using the "gg" command. 

There are currently three locations in which a License can be applied: 
 # Through the UPM for Add-ons. 
 # The Applications page. 

The "Manage all your licenses" link takes the user to [https://my.atlassian.com|https://my.atlassian.com/]

If there is a problem, the product directs the Administrator to raise an issue with Technical Support, where as some in-product guidance might be able to solve the admin user's problem faster.
h3. Suggested Solution

In the event that a license that has been applied is for the wrong product, it would be good to report an error and allow the user to apply the license to the correct product with one click.

Alternatively, give the admin user a place to manage *all* licenses in a simplified way.
h3. Workaround 

N/A
fields.summary: Simplify the Interface for applying a license
Allow JQL to query all dimensions of BitBucket pull requests

h3. Summary

When a change is made to an issue security scheme, nothing is logged in the Audit Log. This means that an administrator could add themselves to a security scheme, look at confidential data, then remove themselves from that scheme without any record of that happening.

This is inconsistent with the other contents of the Audit log, such as keeping a record of Permission Scheme changes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Issue Security for a project.
# Make changes to the Issue Security Scheme.
# Check the Audit Log.

h3. Expected Results

There would be a record of the changes made, consistent with those made to permission schemes.

h3. Actual Results

No new entries are added to the Audit Log.
fields.summary: Issue Security Scheme Changes Are Not Reported In Audit Log

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62184].
  {panel}

The 'Average Time in Status' gadget displays the following text in it:

"This chart shows the average *time spent* in a status for all resolved issues over the past 30 days."

The chart represents the average time a group of issues remained on each status until their resolution date.

However, 'time spent' can be misunderstood as the Time Spent work-logged hours (time tracking).

For disambiguation, I'd suggest to reword that phrase to avoiding the usage of 'time spent' on it, both inside the gadget and in this [documentation page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-use-average-time-in-status-gadget-776998092.html], which states:

"2. This gadget will only show the average *time spent* on the selected statuses for issues that are resolved with a resolution set on the same day. For example, there are 10 issues resolved on March 16, the total *time spent* on each selected status will be divided by 10 issues, despite when these issues are created.
 (...)
 8. The average *time spent* in each status for all resolved issues on the same day will show up in the graph:"
fields.summary: Reword text of 'Average Time In Status' gadget

h3. Summary

The problem is similar to [JRA-45776|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-45776] in which the fix has been applied to Due Date but not to Date Picker custom field:
When user edits an issue it's possible to enter an invalid date in a date picker custom field, such as 16/Dec/20016 or 16/Dec/-2016.

h3. Environment

No Look & Feel changes were made, nor were advanced settings for dates configured - everything is left as the default.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new Date Picker custom field
# Add the newly created custom field to the appropriate screen.
# Edit or create an issue.
# Populate that field with an invalid result, such as 16/Dec/20016.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA returns a validation error as it does for the Due Date field (see screenshot in JIRA 7.1.9 below)
 !2016-08-08_cus-date.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The date is persisted in the database and JIRA throws following index warnings:

{noformat}
2016-08-08 10:12:53,406 http-nio-8080-exec-20 WARN admin 612x45x1 1va8kry 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa [c.a.j.i.i.indexers.impl.LocalDateIndexer] Unable to index custom date field 'cusdatepicker(customfield_10200) with value: 20016-12-16 00:00:00.0
2016-08-08 10:12:53,477 http-nio-8080-exec-20 WARN admin 612x45x1 1va8kry 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa [c.a.j.i.i.indexers.impl.LocalDateIndexer] Unable to index custom date field 'cusdatepicker(customfield_10200) with value: 20016-12-16 00:00:00.0
2016-08-08 10:12:53,615 http-nio-8080-exec-20 WARN admin 612x45x1 1va8kry 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa [c.a.j.i.i.indexers.impl.LocalDateIndexer] Unable to index custom date field 'cusdatepicker(customfield_10200) with value: 20016-12-16 00:00:00.0
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA does not correctly validate Date input for custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62166].
  {panel}

Could you please fix a statement about JIRA's End of Life in [our policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-end-of-life-policy-201851003.html]?

[This announcement on October 22, 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/10/important-support-policy-change/] said,

bq. the new policy will not affect any previously published EOL dates for existing releases.

and JIRA 6.3.8 was released on *October 13, 2014*. That's why JIRA 6.3.x is supposed to be supported until *October 13, 2016* at least.

Could you please add *JIRA 6.3* to the list in [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-end-of-life-policy-201851003.html]?
Additionally, please update the following example in the page to the appropriate one.

bq. Atlassian supports major versions for two years after the first major iteration of that version was released (for example, we support JIRA 6.3.x for 2 years after JIRA 6.3.0 was released).

Cheers,
Yuki
fields.summary: Please fix a statement about JIRA's End of Life?
RSS Feeds for Release Notes
Desktop Notification Support

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62162].
  {panel}

h2. Problem:
There is a need to be able to restrict viewing of issue types in a project based on groups.

Example : Users in Team1 should be able to view and create all issue types (epic, story, task, bug) ( this is the default behaviour and all good ), while users in team2 should be able to just view issue type bug alone in the particular project.

h2. Suggestion:
Add a post function or permission on the project that it will be possible to restrict the view of issues by issue type.
fields.summary: Regarding restricting view based on issue type

Feature Request

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if a user created an issue, he/she will be able to edit all the fields if he/she has the edit permission as well. Some of the users would like feature to restrict for example, reporter to be able to only edit specific fields from the issue that they created.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add permission in field configuration to allow which group/role allowed to add/edit value to the field.

h3. Workaround 

None

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a user creates an issue in JIRA, upon creation, a small notification box will appear in the top right of the screen providing the issue key and a link to the issue. Currently this will only display issues created by the logged in user.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a user, I would like to receive these notifications as well when other users have created issue.
I would like to be able to define whenever a particular user or a user from certain groups has created an issue.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to get the issue created pop-up when other users create issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62153].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The "Recently Created Chart" Gadget on a JIRA Dashboard shows Issues that were created in the current month shifted back into the previous month if the User's Profile has a Timezone Offset later than the Server's Default Timezone.

This causes confusion for users in other regions where their Time Zones differe from the Server who are using these Gadgets
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1000.217.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit dashboard and include a "Recently Created Chart" gadget
 ** Set a Project/Filter and a Period of 'Monthly'
 # Create Issues in the Same Project used by the gadget
 # Change your Profile Time Zone so that it is at least -1 hour to the Server's Default; ie if Chicago, set Time Zone to Denver; if Default is New York, set to Chicago/Mexico City,  etc.
 # Refresh the Dashboard

h3. Expected Results

Gadget shows issues created in Current Month in the Column for the Current Month

!1.ServerDefaultOffset-ChicagoGMT-6.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Testing in the current month of August and setting Time Zone to Denver (rather than my Server's Default of Chicago(GMT-6)) , issues created today are shown in the Gadget to be created in July:

!2.Manual-Denver_GMT-7.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

In a Customer's instance, this is also affecting the 'Daily' period where issues created Today appear on Yesterday's Date 

Found that if a GMT Offset was used that is the same as the Server's Offset; Chicago is GMT-6, if manually selecting GMT-6, the Gadget does not display correctly:
 !5.Manual-GMT-6.png|thumbnail!

However a Manual Offset of GMT-5 or going to +1 hour (or more) to the Server's Default Time Zone, the Gadget displays correctly:
 Manually set Time Zone to GMT-5
 !6.Manual-GMT-5.png|thumbnail!

Manually set Time Zone to New York:
 !3.Manual-NY_GMT-5.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Users in a Different Time Zone See Recently Created Chart Off by One Day/Month
Custom notification when adding a component

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62148].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The same custom field might be used in two different projects, but the select lists or multi check box option requirements could be different for each project. Thus, users must create a separate custom field with a different name to meet the criteria for the separate projects' field options, since it's not recommended to create multiple fields with the same name. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create the ability to dynamically create separate field options depending on context - when associated with a specific screen or transition.  

h3. Workaround 
The only workaround is to create a separate custom field with a slightly different name in order to achieve separate field options.
fields.summary: Dynamic field options

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA 7 Supported platforms documentation still lists multiple tomcat versions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Currently on 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Supported+platforms
and
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Supported+platforms

for the listed supported Application servers these documents still list Apache Tomcat 6.x and 7.x versions.   
{quote}

    6.0.32
    7.0.29
    8.0.x*
 
{quote}


h3. Notes
I believe that the 6.x and 7.x versions are actually held over from the JIRA 6 and prior documentation where it was possible to have JIRA deployed in a WAR install.   In those cases the user would choose the version of tomcat to deploy JIRA to.   Since JIRA 7.0, there are no WAR releases, hence you have to run JIRA Server on the version of Tomcat that is supplied with JIRA (8.0.x).

I do not believe there is a need to continue to support those older Tomcat platforms in the JIRA 7 world.  As such I think we should adjust these documents and future JIRA 7 docs to reflect this.
fields.summary: JIRA 7 Supported platforms documentation still lists multiple tomcat versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62144].
  {panel}

Ability to filter linked issue mapped to a project or list of key which are part of a different filter

* Currently we have multiple projects and we maintain user stories in each of it.
* To maintain test cases we maintain all test cases in a separate project for better tracking and stay organized.
* Test cases / Test tasks are linked to "User Stories" of different projects.

Now for tracking, I am looking at filtering all Test task which are linked to "User Stories" of a particular project. How can I do that? Please share any ideas.
fields.summary: Ability to filter linked issue mapped to a project or list of key which are part of a different filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62143].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The [JIRA Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Supported+platforms] documentation mentions a *Minimum screen resolution of 1024 x 768 (when browsers are maximized).*

However, when trying to refine a Cumulative Flow Diagram using the "*Refine Report*" functionality, a pop up appears with all the Quick Filters configured for the board. But users are unable to view all the filters as shown in the images below.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your system display to the recommended resolution of 1024 x 768, or under. 
# Add a few Quick filters to the board. 
# Click on reports > Cumulative Flow Diagram
# Click on Refine Report.

h3. Expected Results
# The *Refine Report* pop up should be able to resize and display all the filters as shown in the image below:
 !refine-report-expected.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results 
# The *Refine Report* seems to be distorted and missing a few *Quick Filters* as shown in the image below:
 !refine-report-actual.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Change the Display Resolution to a resolution higher than the supported --> 1024 x 768
fields.summary: Using the minimum recommended screen resolution, users are unable to view filters in Cumulative flow diagrams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62142].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When accessing Cloud account via mobile device, without entering https://, it automatically visits http://, unlike in the desktop version.  

h3. Environment
* Reported and tested with Confluence 1000.177.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a mobile device, navigate to Cloud URL without entering https://
# It's important that it's a Cloud instance you've never visited
# URL will direct to http://instance.atlassian.net and throw an error

h3. Expected Results
As per desktop version, it should direct to https:// version.

h3. Actual Results
Directs to http:// version

h3.Workaround
Visit https://instance.atlassian.net and henceforth you will be directed to the proper URL on that device.
fields.summary: Accessing site via mobile device automatically directs to http://

fields.summary: Internal server error when asking for createmeta of specific project through REST API
New AJAX transition from parent issue to sub-task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62134].
  {panel}

Judging by the URL, the following two pages are specific to cloud or server, but the server page references Connect in the preamble, and the cloud page links to various tutorials in the JIRADEV space:

* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/

Take a second pass at this content, and separate the server and cloud links/topics.
fields.summary: JIRA REST API cloud reference doc links to server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62132].
  {panel}

Linux distributions can be automatically configured during provisioning with kickstart. It is then possible to provision with tools like Foreman and Puppet a server which has Jira installed.
But unfortunately, Jira still needs manual setup afterwards - license, administration user etc.

It would be really cool if Jira (and the other Atlassian applications) would recognize some kind of bootstrapping file in the home folder, which has instructions about the setup: database name, license, users, application links etc. etc.

Jira should then on first boot, provideded there is no information in the database and in the home folder, load this configuration file and do the bootstrapping without any manual intervention.

Basically, the goal would be to automatically provision a VM and afterwards have a running Jira, where a administrator can log into.
fields.summary: Automatic bootstrapping of installation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62131].

h3. Problem Definition
Currently by looking at filename it is not clear from which node support.zip file was generated . You need to open file to check that. 


h3. Suggested Solution
Add the Cluster Node name to the support.zip filename
See related: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STP-736

h3. Workaround 
none

h3. Problem Definition
In *Issue Detail View* when an subtask is completed it is not shown with strike-trough.

h3. Environment

* Jira Cloud 1000.245.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a subtast
# Transition to Done
# View parent issue in the *Issue Detail View*

h3. Expected Results
Show subtask with strike-trough
 !subtask with strike trough.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Subtask is not strike-trough
 !subtask in issue detail view.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When loading a JIRA Dashboard page, if gadgets are present the browser will make a high number of requests to server for the webresources (CSS, JS) to load the results. Gadgets do not batch those resources into files such as {{batch.js}} or {{batch.css}}, so the number of web requests can significantly increase dependent on the higher number of gadgets.

The same issue occurs when gadgets are added in Confluence pages.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install a vanilla instance of Jira Software.
 #* This was validated on Jira Software 6.4 and 8.5.3.
# Create a _Scrum software development_ project with sample data.
# Create a new Dashboard from the _Blank dashboard_.
# Add a gadget that will pull data from the sample project created in a previous step.
 #* For example, add a _Recently Created Chart_ gadget.
# Open the developer tools of your browser and load the Dashboard with the new gadget.

h3. Expected Results
The dashboard will be loaded on the browser using the minimum number of requests as possible.
CSS and JavaScript files related to the gadget are batched.

h3. Actual Results
Requests for CSS and JavaScript files are not batched and loading a Dashboard with a single gadget creates hundreds of requests from the browser to the Jira server backend.

h3. Notes

Reviewing the response of the gadget response from something such as [http://jira.example.com:60641/jira6412/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr] we can see a high number of files to download:
{code}

\\
\\
Adding multiple gadgets on the same dashboard will increase the number of requests.
This seems to affect users on any browser, but is more consistently reproducible on Chrome.

h3. Workaround
_Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available._
fields.summary: Unbatched gadgets responses when loading Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62125].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Atlassian Cloud comes with an internal SMTP server configured to send notifications and it's a restricted function to configure an SMTP Mail Server.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to configure alternate SMTP Account or an SMTP relay instead of sending from your service with just a modified from address.
fields.summary: Ability to configure SMTP server (JIRA Cloud)
Add other fields to bubble chart gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62123].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to disable index recovery when JIRA start up. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce the ability or option to disable index recovery on start up
fields.summary: Option to disable index recovery on start up

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 5 June 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

This is a known issue; however we don't anticipate that we will take steps to address it in the foreseeable future. When a workflow is configured with validators, conditions, or post-functions there can be cases of complex interdependencies. Simply removing these can change the behavior of the workflow itself in unpredictable ways.

Additionally, the effort required to implement and maintain a solution for these incompatibilities is not justified by the severity of the issue.
Thanks for your patience and understanding,

 
Regards,
Ignat Alexeyenko
ialexeyenko@atlassian.com
JIRA bugmaster
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62122].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Due to the removal of certain plugins within JIRA Cloud, such as the JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions, certain parts of the code have been moved into JIRA Cloud. This is detailed further in [JIRA Miscellaneous Workflow Extensions (JMWE) removal from JIRA Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-miscellaneous-workflow-extensions-jmwe-removal-from-jira-cloud-815262011.html]. However, some of the code changes have not made it into JIRA Server, so when migrating from Cloud to Server the workflows will be broken as they reference classes that do not exist.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a workflow with JMWE 'Fields Required' validator or the 'set issue security from role' post-function.
 # Export the instance to Server.
 # Install JMWE plugin.
 # Try to use the workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The workflow proceeds as normal.
h3. Actual Results

The workflow fails to transition with the below error:
{noformat}
[c.a.jira.workflow.DefaultOSWorkflowConfigurator] Could not load class 'com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator'
{noformat}
Or
{noformat}
2016-10-23 15:54:58,073 ProjectImport: CreateIssues:thread-3 ERROR sysadmin 954x14300x1 v23cek 10.0.0.2 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary.jspa [c.a.jira.workflow.DefaultOSWorkflowConfigurator] Could not load class 'com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.SetIssueSecurityFromRoleFunction'
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

The Add-on Vendor Innovalog has published a Knowledge Base article detailing the actions required when migrating from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server when you were using JMWE for JIRA Cloud: https://innovalog.atlassian.net/wiki/x/CatOC

While some of these steps and bits of information are published in the mentioned knowledge base article, here is the summary of what has to be done.

This can be worked around by renaming the new class names back to the old class names. For example renaming {{com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator}} to {{com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.validators.FieldRequiredValidator}} in the workflows will fix the problem.
h3. Notes

Reviewing the XML backups before and after the change shows the problem is obvious - the class name has changed:
{code:java|title=After}
			<validator name="" type="class">
              <arg name="contextHandling"></arg>
              <arg name="hidFieldsList">customfield_13600</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage"></arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator</arg>
            </validator>
            <validator name="" type="class">
              <arg name="contextHandling"></arg>
              <arg name="hidFieldsList">customfield_12719</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage">.</arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator</arg>
            </validator>
{code}
{code:java|title=Before}
			<validator name="" type="class">
			
              <arg name="fieldKey">customfield_13600</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage"></arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.validators.FieldRequiredValidator</arg>
            </validator>
            <validator name="" type="class">
			
              <arg name="fieldKey">customfield_12719</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage"></arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.validators.FieldRequiredValidator</arg>
            </validator>
{code}
The below contains a summary of changes:
||From||To||
|{{com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator}}|{{com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.validators.FieldRequiredValidator}}|
|{{com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.SetIssueSecurityFromRoleFunction}}|{{com.innovalog.jmwe.plugins.functions.SetIssueSecurityFromRoleFunction}}|
fields.summary: Export from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server fails due to Jira Misc Workflow Extensions changes
